dublinCore.dc:title: 119 HRES 308 RH: Dismissing the election contest relating to the office of Representative from the Fourteenth Congressional District of Florida.
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

action.action-desc: Mr. Steil, from the Committee on House Administration, reported the following resolution; which was referred to the House Calendar and ordered to be printed

form.official-title: Dismissing the election contest relating to the office of Representative from the Fourteenth Congressional District of Florida.

section.text: That the election contest filed on November 17, 2024, relating to the office of Representative from the Fourteenth Congressional District of Florida is dismissed on the grounds that, under section 2(1) of the Federal Contested Election Act (2 U.S.C. 381(1)), the House of Representatives has jurisdiction over official general and special elections to choose a Representative in, or Delegate or Resident Commissioner to, the Congress, but does not have jurisdiction over a primary election, or a caucus or convention of a political party.

endorsement.action-desc: Referred to the House Calendar and ordered to be printed
